sec.p: All the reactions were performed at room temperature. In a round bottom flask, a 5 mL solution in CH 3CN of preformed N-propargylaniline 3a-g (1.0 mmol) and formaldehyde (37% in methanol) 4 (1.1 mmol) was prepared and stirred for 10 minutes. 5 mL solution of InCl 3 (20% mol) in CH 3CN was then added. After 20 minutes a solution of N-vinylformamide 5 (1.1 mmol) in CH 3CN was incorporated to the reaction mixture and was vigorously stirred. The resulting mixture was stirred for 3â€“4 h. After the workup, the final product was purified by column chromatography, eluted with the appropriate mixture of petroleum ether and ethyl acetate to afford pure THQs 6a-g.
